sub_title: Lecturer at Hanze University of Applied Sciences, Groningen. Writer, Ornithologist, Conservationist.
summary:
I am a trained biologist with over 15 years experience in both research and applied conservation. I did research in ornithology, in areas such as foraging ecology, breeding biology and habitat selection of shorebirds, marine birds and raptors. I also participated in a conservation project that successfully returned a breeding population of black vultures to southern Portugal.
At present I am lecturer at the Hanze University of Applied Sciences, in The Netherlands, where I mostly teach biology, research skills and ethics to electrical engineering students, providing them with the knowledge they need to apply their engineering skills in fields such as health and biomedicine, agriculture and environmental monitoring.
I am also a writer, mostly writing about nature and the natural world. I published three children books, two collections of short stories, and one book about my experience doing field work in the remote Selvagem Islands. I mostly write in Portuguese, but have translated two of my children books to English.

profile_positions.company: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen
profile_positions.description: Lecturer at the Hanze University of Applied Sciences, Groningen, teaching Biology, Physiology, Research Skills, and Ethics to bachelor and master students studying Electrical Engineering, Sensor Technology and Smart Systems Engineering.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

company.name: CESAM (Centre for Environment and Sea Studies); Faculty of Sciences of the University of Lisboa

profile_positions.company: CESAM (Centre for Environment and Sea Studies); Faculty of Sciences of the University of Lisboa
profile_positions.description: Working on several research projects that aimed to study the migration of waders between West African wintering areas and staging areas in western Europe, using stable isotope information from bird toenails, as well as establishing a baseline of ecological knowledge over the Bijagós archipelago of Guinea-Bissau.
profile_positions.title: Post-doc researcher

profile_positions.description: Raptor monitoring around windfarm development areas, as part of an ongoing effort to monitor and minimize bird fatalities caused by windfarms.
profile_positions.title: Field Biologist

company.name: CEAI (Centro de Estudos de Avifauna Ibérica)

profile_positions.company: CEAI (Centro de Estudos de Avifauna Ibérica)
profile_positions.description: I was one of the biologists working together to implement a set of conservation action to improve the conditions for two endangered species in south-eastern portugal: the black vulture and the Iberian lynx.
profile_positions.title: Biologist

profile_positions.description: During my time at the University of groningen and work on my thesis, entittled Staging ecology of black-tailed godwits in Portuguese rice fields and correlations with breeding season events", in which I studied the various aspects of the ecology of these birds during their migratory staging period in agricultural habitats in Portugal, as well on their breeding ecology in agricultural grasslands in the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: PhD student

profile_positions.description: Consultant for a report on the threats faced by black-tailed godwits (Limosa limosa) on the different areas used by the species during migration. Was responsible for field work and data analysis regarding the use of Portuguese rice fields by this species, as well as writing a chapter of the final report.
profile_positions.title: Consultor independente

profile_positions.description: Raptor monitoring around windfarm development areas, as part of an ongoing effort to monitor and minimize bird fatalities caused by windfarms.
profile_positions.title: Field Biologist

company.name: Faculty of Sciences University of Lisbon

profile_positions.company: Faculty of Sciences University of Lisbon
profile_positions.description: Took part in field work, data analysis and writing of scientific papers under the scope of a project studying the importance of nocturnal foraging for shorebirds wintering in the Tejo estuary.
profile_positions.title: Junior Research Scientist

profile_positions.description: In a study on the impact of power lines on birds. Collection and identification of the corpses of birds victimized by power lines.
profile_positions.title: Field Biologist

profile_positions.description: Guiding tourists and school children visiting the Mafra National Forest. The visits had a strong environmental education component, with main focus on forestry and forest fires, hunting, and endangered species.
profile_positions.title: Tourist Guide

company.name: SPEA - Sociedade Portuguesa para o Estudo das Aves

volunteer_experiences.description: Production of articles for the Pardela, the journal that all members of the Society receive 3-4 times a year. The texts deal with a range of ornithological topics such as the ornithological interest of different countries/regions (e.g. Uganda, Iceland, Bijagós archipelago in Guinea-Bissau), conservation issues affecting birds (e.g. microplastic pollution, shrimp farms) and ornithological research in Portugal.
Behavioural observations of captive gibbons (Hydrobates lar) and writing of a small article on this subject for the Zoo's newsletter.

company.name: SPEA - Sociedade Portuguesa para o Estudo das Aves

volunteer_experiences.description: Environmental education actions in several schools, under the main theme: “Birds and the Environment”. Production of an interactive presentation that accompanied a photographic exposition under the subject “Birds of the Azores Islands”.

company.name: SPEA - Sociedade Portuguesa para o Estudo das Aves

volunteer_experiences.description: Surveillance of Bonnelli’s Eagle (Hieraaetus fasciatus) nests in Southern Portugal to avoid the risk of logging operations affecting the reproduction of this endangered species.

company.name: SPEA - Sociedade Portuguesa para o Estudo das Aves

volunteer_experiences.description: Collaborator in the Portuguese Common Bird Census, being responsible for performing censuses in one of the 10x10 km sampling units.

company.name: SPEA - Sociedade Portuguesa para o Estudo das Aves

volunteer_experiences.description: Collaborator in the Portuguese Migratory and Wintering Bird Atlas, being responsible for performing censuses in several 10x10 km sampling units

volunteer_experiences.description: Collaborator in the Portuguese Nocturnal Bird Survey, being responsible for performing censuses in one of the 10x10 km sampling units.
